meanings.definition: A woman who holds property jointly with her husband.
meanings.sent1: The jointress and her husband own the house together.
meanings.sent2: The jointress inherited the land from her parents.
meanings.sent3: The jointress and her husband argued over who gets to pick the paint color for the walls.
meanings.sent4: She was the jointress of the family business, ensuring its success.
meanings.sent5: The jointress managed the finances of the property with great care.

meanings.definition: A woman who is a joint owner of property.
meanings.sent1: The jointress shared ownership of the antique shop with her sister.
meanings.sent2: As a jointress, she had equal rights to the estate.
meanings.sent3: The jointress accidentally sold her own painting at the garage sale.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a jointress of the majestic castle, overseeing its grandeur.
meanings.sent5: The jointress proudly displayed the family heirlooms in the living room.

meanings.definition: A woman who is a co-owner of property.
meanings.sent1: The jointress and her business partner invested in the new venture.
meanings.sent2: As a jointress, she had a say in the decisions regarding the property.
meanings.sent3: The jointress and her friend decided to plant a garden in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a jointress of the ocean, sharing its vastness with the world.
meanings.sent5: The jointress took pride in maintaining the shared property with care.
